Military Record for John J. Moran

div1.p: This record concerns Moran's assignments in France with the Quartermaster Corps, his return to the United States, and his honorable discharge.

div1.head: Letter from E. E. BOOTH, August 30, 1919
div1.opener:
AMERICAN EXPEDITIONARY FORCES
HEADQUARTERS SERVICES OF SUPPLY
France,August 30, 1919.
Embarkation Orders.
No.
242
Extract
div1.p:
Par. 7/ Pursuant to authority contained in telegram from G.H.Q.,
A.E.F., dated November 17, 1918, Captain J.J. Moran, Q.M.C., is
relieved from further duty with the A.E.F., and will proceed upon
expiration of leave of absence heretofore granted him to Headquarters
Base Section No. 5, on or before September 9th, 1919 reporting to
the Commanding General for return to the United States.

Upon arrival in the United States he will report to the Commanding
General, Port of Debarkation, for discharge from the service.

Compliance with this order after arrival in the United States is
subject to such delays as may be imposed by the authorities at the port of
debarkation in accordance with orders from the War Department relative
to debarkation, disinfection, quarantine, and demobilization.
The travel directed is necessary in the military service.

Copies furnished Aug. 30, 1919.
1 to C.G., B.S. #5.
1 to Q.M.C.
div1.closer:
By Command of Brigadier General Connor: E.E. BOOTH,
Chief of Staff. Official:
HARRISON hALL,
Adjutant General.

div1.head: Letter from JOSEPH A. MARMON, September 18, 1919
div1.opener:
HEADQUARTERS PORT OF EMBARKATION
HOBOKEN, NEW JERSEY
September 18, 1919 a.
SPECIAL ORDERS
NO. 261
[EXTRACT]
* * * * *
div1.p:
35. Captain John J. Moran, Quartermaster Corps, Class 2,
having returned from abroad September 18, 1919, and having reported
at these headquarters this date, will, under authority of the
Adjutant General of the Army, dated July 29, 1919, proceed to
Washington, D.C., reporting upon arrival to the Director of Finance
for duty.
The travel directed is necessary in the military service.
div1.closer:
BY COMMAND OF MAJOR GENERAL SHANKS: JOSEPH A. MARMON,
T.W. OLIVER,
Gen. Staff,
xxxxx. XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
OFFICIAL
D. A. WATT,
LIEUT. COL., A. C.,
PORT ADJUTANT.
